# ARSkeleton3D

**Class**

The skeleton of a human body that ARKit tracks in 3D space.

## Declaration

```swift
class ARSkeleton3D
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARBodyAnchor] contains one instance of this [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton] subclass to provide its joint positions in 3D space. The [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/jointLocalTransforms-1m5a1] property describes a joint’s 3D offset from its parent joint. The [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/jointModelTransforms-dno4] property describes a joint’s 3D offset from the body anchor’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor/transform].

## Getting a Joint’s Pose

- **jointLocalTransforms**: The local space transforms for each joint.
- **jointModelTransforms**: The model space transforms for each joint.
- **localTransform(for:)**: Returns the local transform for a joint with a given name.
- **modelTransform(for:)**: Returns the model transform for a joint with a given name.

## Body Data

- **Capturing Body Motion in 3D**: Track a person in the physical environment and visualize their motion by applying the same body movements to a virtual character.
- **ARBody2D**: The screen-space representation of a person ARKit recognizes in the camera feed.
- **ARSkeleton2D**: An object that describes the locations of a body’s joints in the camera feed.
- **ARSkeleton**: The interface for the skeleton of a tracked body.
- **ARSkeletonDefinition**: The hierarchy of joints and their names.
